column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Triticale is an increasingly popular cereal species which acreage continues to grow steadily in Poland .
#Text=Triticale ranks second after wheat in terms of cropped area , and this highly versatile crop has a wide range of end use possibilities .
#Text=The area sown with triticale in Poland constitutes about 34 % of the area of this species in the world .
#Text=European agriculture has also appreciated this species .
#Text=In the last decade , the area sown with triticale increased by 30 % .
#Text=This undoubtedly confirms the growing position of this species .
#Text=The energy consumption in agriculture has been increasing due to the decreasing arable land , the growing population , the growing machine number , and the pursuit of higher living standards .

#Text=The Integrated Farming System , the key to which is an attempt at reconciliation of seemingly contradictory economic ( assumption of high farming effectiveness ) , environmental , and social goals , represents one of the concepts of sustainable agriculture development .
#Text=Sustainable development results from assuming the principle of integrated order seen as consistent and simultaneous perception of the economic , social , and natural order .

#Text=Agriculture is the sector of the economy in which the most favorable conditions for implementation of the principles of sustainable development exist because , on the one hand , resources of the natural environment are used there , and on the other , farmers , through their activities , shape that environment .
#Text=In modern farming systems , profitability is closely associated with a reduction in agricultural inputs .
#Text=One of the methods for evaluating agricultural production relies on the concept of energy consumption .
#Text=According to Pawlak , growing prices of energy contribute to the effective use of agricultural inputs .

#Text=There is a growing need for new solutions that would improve energy efficiency in agricultural production , increase the competitive advantage of economies , and contribute to environmental protection .
#Text=The changes in energy efficiency should be regularly monitored .
#Text=Previous research showed that the assessment of energy consumption and its efficiency has an influence on improving the efficiency of energy use when receiving similar crop productivity .

#Text=According to OECD ( The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development ) , improving energy efficiency in agriculture will reduce GHG ( greenhouse gases ) emissions nitrous , especially Oxide ( N2O ) and methane ( CH4 ) .
#Text=In agriculture , energy efficiency depends on the type and production intensity , mechanization , and the applied production technology .
#Text=Agricultural inputs and expenditures can be minimized by selecting the most appropriate means of production and optimizing agricultural technologies .
#Text=Depending on the purpose of the analysis , the energy efficiency of plant production is determined using various methods .
#Text=No standard methods for calculating the energy balance have been defined yet .
#Text=Methods found in the literature often differ significantly , especially in terms of energy equivalents .
#Text=Energy equivalents are not static values and must be adapted to local conditions. .

#Text=It is necessary to undertake systemic research on the harmonization of contractual conversion factors for energy units of individual agricultural raw materials intended for caloric food products or for biofuels ( RES ) with a specific heat value .
#Text=The conversion of agricultural products into conventional cereal units should also be updated .
#Text=Currently , the search for alternative energy sources has become an urgent need .
#Text=Fuels from plant sources are used in huge amounts .
#Text=Biofuels are considered safe for the environment , improve energy security , and do not negatively affect the food market .
#Text=The need to acquire energy from other alternative sources arises from the fact that fossil fuels are limited in amount .
#Text=First generation biofuels ( biodiesel , bioethanol ) and gas fuels are still the basic sources of renewable energy .
#Text=They are either obtained from food and fodder raw materials by fermentation or transesterification processes .
#Text=One of the most important biofuels used in transport is bioethanol , which is recognized as environmentally safe , renewable fuel .
#Text=A very important factor shaping the demand for agricultural products is growing purchases from entities operating outside the agri-food sector .
#Text=Among them , fuel and energy concerns that use agricultural products in the biofuel production process are of particular importance .
#Text=It is assumed that competition in the use of agricultural raw materials for biofuels negatively affects food prices and therefore contributes to the deepening of world hunger .
#Text=In recent years , there have also been analyses attributing biofuels a role smaller than before in the negative influence on agricultural market prices .
#Text=The use of a part of soil resources for biomass production limits the potential of food production , which may result in an increase in its price .
#Text=Agriculture is expected to continue to increase productivity to meet the food needs of the growing world population .
#Text=In recent years , the production of bioethanol grew dynamically , exceeding 8.2 billion liters in the EU ( 2016 ) , while global production reached 119.7 billion liters .
#Text=About 6.1 % of cereal production in the world ( wheat , fodder grains ) and 5.0 % of harvest in the EU was used for this purpose .
#Text=In 2005 , cereal grains were used much less in the production of bioethanol , 2.7 % in the world , and 1.0 % in the EU .
